name: The Snug
description: Being a bar expect it to be busy at lunch and in the evenings. They also have cocktail making classes that can be earlier in the day so be aware of raucous parties. Early morning and mid afternoon will be quieter but with a buzz of work and people around you.
opening_hours: Monday to Wednesday 10am - 11pm | Thursday to Saturday 10am - Midnight | Sunday 10am - 10pm

name: Reading Room
description: The larger of the two seating areas in the College Library, the Reading Room has a variety of tables and chairs with natural light, seating for up to 60 individuals, a large part of the bookstock and a busy but studious atmosphere.
opening_hours: [This varies between term time and vacation]

name: Lower Library
description: The Lower Library is a quieter area of the College Library with less natural light and fewer seats (max. 10). Sound carries from the floor above and there is a certain amount of through traffic. However, it is less busy than the Reading Room and houses a large part of the bookstock.
opening_hours: [This varies between term time and vacation]

name: Reading Room
description: The largest reading room in the UL, with seating for over 200.  The Reading Room houses the Library's main reference collection and has a busy but studious atmosphere.
address: Cambridge University Library, West Road, Cambridge, CB3 9DR
opening_hours: 0900-1900 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700, Sunday Closed. Easter term 0900-2100 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700 Sunday Closed.

name: North Front corridor
description: Bookshelves work to form booths with large desks that seats two people. The desk faces the busy North Front walk way and is close to the Tea Room.
address: Cambridge University Library, West Road, Cambridge, CB3 9DR
opening_hours: 0900-1900 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700, Sunday Closed. Easter term 0900-2100 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700 Sunday Closed.

name: West 4
description: Part of a modern extension, this desk space is within a spacious area of shelving.  This is the only place within the UL to have computer chairs that are height adjustable.
address: Cambridge University Library, West Road, Cambridge, CB3 9DR
opening_hours: 0900-1900 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700, Sunday Closed. Easter term 0900-2100 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700 Sunday Closed.

name: Assistive Technology Room
description: Located in a small, private, wood panelled room, the Assistive Technology Room offers ergonomic chairs, height adjustable desks and computers with assistive technology.
address: Cambridge University Library, West Road, Cambridge, CB3 9DR
opening_hours: 0900-1900 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700, Sunday Closed. Easter term 0900-2100 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700 Sunday Closed.

name: Fourth Floor Landing
description: One of the most historical looking parts of the library, populated with portraits of former UL librarians.  Dark, heavy furniture means that although there is plenty of natural light, it still feels cosy.  The space is not always available as it is occasionally used as meeting space by Library staff.
address: Cambridge University Library, West Road, Cambridge, CB3 9DR
opening_hours: 0900-1900 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700, Sunday Closed. Easter term 0900-2100 Monday-Friday, Saturday 0900-1700 Sunday Closed.

name: Lower Ground Floor
opening_hours: 0900-2100 Monday-Friday (or 0900-1700 outside Full Term), and 0900-1300 on Saturday
tags: reading list material. natural science tripos

name: Ground Floor
opening_hours: 0900-2100 Monday-Friday (or 0900-1700 outside Full Term), and 0900-1300 on Saturday
tags: reading list material. natural science tripos

name: 1st Floor
opening_hours: 0900-2100 Monday-Friday (or 0900-1700 outside Full Term), and 0900-1300 on Saturday
tags: reading list material. natural science tripos

name: 2nd Floor
opening_hours: 0900-2100 Monday-Friday (or 0900-1700 outside Full Term), and 0900-1300 on Saturday
tags: reading list material. natural science tripos

name: Non-Fiction and Reference floor
description: Brilliant for group study, but don't forget being a public library you are likely to get bunches of Alevel/GSCE kids workign together here in peak college/school term.
address: 7 Lion Yard, Grand Arcade, Cambridge, CB2 3QD
opening_hours: Monday-Tuesday 9am - 6pm, Wednesday 9am - 7pm, Thursday - Friday 9am - 6pm, Saturday 10am - 6pm, Sunday 12noon - 4pm

name: Non-Fiction Floor
description: This floor has the most nooks, for finding a place of your own. But, it gets full very quickly so best to come early.
address: 7 Lion Yard, Grand Arcade, Cambridge, CB2 3QD
opening_hours: Monday-Tuesday 9am - 6pm, Wednesday 9am - 7pm, Thursday - Friday 9am - 6pm, Saturday 10am - 6pm, Sunday 12noon - 4pm

name: Fiction and Children's Library Floor
description: This is likely to be busiest floor for comings and goings and the floor with all the kids.
address: 7 Lion Yard, Grand Arcade, Cambridge, CB2 3QD
opening_hours: Monday-Tuesday 9am - 6pm, Wednesday 9am - 7pm, Thursday - Friday 9am - 6pm, Saturday 10am - 6pm, Sunday 12noon - 4pm

name: Reading Room
description: The reading room is the quietest room in the library and is the only designated laptop/typing free zone. There are large desk spaces as well as two sofas and a comfy chair. Each desk has an individual lamp and power sockets.
opening_hours: 24 hours, 365 days

name: Basement Study Room
description: The basement study room has large desks with individual lamps and power sockets.

name: Mezzanine Study Room
description: The mezzanine study room has large desks, including some with views of the river and Latham lawn. There are two comfortable window seats.

name: 1st Floor Study Room
description: The mezzanine study room has large desks all facing the river or Latham lawn.

name: Law Floor Study Room
description: The law floor study room has large desks, including some with views of the river and Latham lawn.

name: Computer Room
description: The computer room is located at the top of the library. It has both Mac and Windows computers, scanners and colour and black and white printers

name: Desktop Services Room
description: The library's main computer room, with facilities for printing, as well as an e-legal deposit machine. Ten computers available here.
opening_hours: Varies - whenever the library is open

name: ASNC desks
description: Located at the top of the library by the ASNC collection, this has several study spaces, computers and a B&W printer. Often used by ASNC students to save them carrying the heavy books too far.
opening_hours: Varies - whenever the library is open

name: Balcony desks
description: Located on the first floor, with individual study carrels, and a good view of those working on the floor below.
opening_hours: Varies - whenever the library is open

name: Newman's Corner
description: Our comfy seating area, with armchairs and beanbags and often a jigsaw or two, this is a super place to relax and get some reading done.
opening_hours: Varies - whenever the library is open

name: Ground floor windows
description: Probably the main study area of the library, on the ground floor just as you come into the library. Lots of large desks, people nearby, and easy access to lots of the books.
opening_hours: Varies - whenever the library is open

name: Ground floor side desks
description: On the ground floor, and with views of the History Faculty, these desks are quieter and slightly more secluded than the open desks on the other side of the floor.
opening_hours: Varies - whenever the library is open

name: Lower Ground Floor
opening_hours: Varies
restriction: DMB has access restrictions where Library is located; card controlled; Faculty Reception staff on duty during office hours

name: Lily Pad 1
opening_hours: Varies
restriction: DMB has access restrictions where Library is located; card controlled; Faculty Reception staff on duty during office hours

opening_hours: Varies
